perturbation.original_text: The Licensee agrees that the business operated by it in connection with the Licensed Mark shall comply with all laws, rules, regulations and requirements of any governmental body in the Territory or elsewhere as may be applicable to the operation, advertising, and promotion of the business and that it shall notify the Licensor of any action that must be taken by the Licensee to comply with such law, rules, regulations or requirements.
perturbation.changed_text: The Licensee agrees that the business operated by it in connection with the Licensed Mark shall comply with some laws, rules, regulations and requirements of any governmental body in the Territory or elsewhere as may be applicable to the operation, advertising, and promotion of the business and that it is not required to notify the Licensor of any action that must be taken by the Licensee to comply with such law, rules, regulations or requirements.
perturbation.explanation: By changing 'all laws' to 'some laws' and removing the requirement to notify the Licensor, the contract introduces ambiguity and potentially allows the Licensee to selectively comply with regulations. In New York (the governing law), businesses are legally obligated to adhere to all applicable laws, especially in regulated industries like finance. This change introduces a loophole that could be interpreted as permitting non-compliance. Removing the notification requirement hinders oversight and enforcement of compliance.
perturbation.contradicted_law: New York General Business Law and related regulations governing business operations and advertising standards.

perturbation.original_text: In order to preserve the inherent value of the Licensed Mark, the Licensee agrees to use reasonable efforts to ensure that it maintains the quality of its business and the operation thereof equal to the standards prevailing in the operation of the Licensor's and the Licensee's businesses as of the date of this Agreement. The Licensee further agrees to use the Licensed Mark in accordance with such quality standards as may be reasonably established by the Licensor and communicated to the Licensee from time to time in writing, or as may be agreed to by the Licensor and the Licensee from time to time in writing. The Licensee agrees to allow the Licensor to conduct reasonable inspection of the quality of the Licensee's services from time to time.
perturbation.changed_text: The Licensee agrees to use efforts to ensure that it maintains the quality of its business and the operation thereof to some standards prevailing in the operation of the Licensee's businesses as of the date of this Agreement. The Licensee agrees to use the Licensed Mark in accordance with the Licensee standards.
perturbation.explanation: The original text requires reasonable effort to maintain the quality of the business and operations equal to the standards of both the licensor and licensee at the time of the agreement. This change weakens that requirement, removing the 'reasonable efforts' aspect, using the standard of the Licensee's businesses, and removing the reference to the Licensor's standards. This change contradicts the obligation to uphold a certain quality standard, which could create legal issues if the Licensee's services are subpar or damage the brand's reputation.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Trademark law principles requiring licensees to maintain quality control to avoid deceptive use of the trademark, as interpreted under Lanham Act principles.

perturbation.original_text: Each party hereby represents and warrants to the other party as follows: (a) Due Authorization. Such party is a corporation or limited liability company duly incorporated or organized and in good standing as of the Effective Date, and the execution, delivery and performance of this Agreement by such party have been duly authorized by all necessary action on the part of such party. (b) Due Execution. This Agreement has been duly executed and delivered by such party and, upon due authorization, execution and delivery of this Agreement by the other party, constitutes a legal, valid and binding obligation of such party, enforceable against such party in accordance with its terms. (c) No Conflict. Such party's execution, delivery and performance of this Agreement do not: (i) violate, conflict with or result in the breach of any provision of the charter or by-laws (or similar organizational documents) of such party; (ii) conflict with or violate any governmental order applicable to such party or any of its assets, properties or businesses; or (iii) conflict with, result in any breach of, constitute a default (or event which with the giving of notice or lapse of time, or both, would become a default) under, require any consent under, or give to others any rights of termination, amendment, acceleration, suspension, revocation or cancellation of any contract, agreement, lease, sublease, license, permit, franchise or other instrument or arrangement to which it is a party.
perturbation.changed_text: Each party hereby represents and warrants to the other party as follows: (a) Due Authorization. Such party is a corporation or limited liability company. (b) Due Execution. This Agreement has been duly executed and delivered by such party and, upon due authorization, execution and delivery of this Agreement by the other party, constitutes a legal obligation of such party, enforceable against such party. (c) No Conflict. Such party's execution, delivery and performance of this Agreement do not: (i) violate any provision of the charter or by-laws (or similar organizational documents) of such party; (ii) conflict with or violate any governmental order applicable to such party or any of its assets, properties or businesses.
perturbation.explanation: The removal of 'in good standing as of the Effective Date' from the Due Authorization clause weakens the assurance that the company is legally compliant. The Due Execution clause removes 'valid and binding', which is critical for ensuring the agreement is legally sound. Also the removal of (iii) of No Conflict clause. These removals weaken the legal protections for both parties, creating a potential for disputes and legal challenges if either party is not fully compliant or if prior agreements conflict.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Basic contract law principles requiring clear and unambiguous representations and warranties regarding a party's legal standing and ability to fulfill contractual obligations, governed by New York law.
